Based on their message, it seems like they are interested in crime-related movies. Here are two highly regarded crime films that you might enjoy: 

1. The Godfather (1972) directed by Francis Ford Coppola is a classic crime film that tells the story of the Corleone family and their involvement in organized crime. This movie has won numerous awards, including five Academy Awards.

2. Goodfellas (1990) directed by Martin Scorsese is another iconic crime film that tells the story of Henry Hill, a young mobster from Long Island, New York. This movie has won numerous awards, including seven Academy Awards.

I hope you enjoy these two highly regarded crime films.

Based on their message, it seems like they are interested in drama films. Here are two movie recommendations from the list you provided:

1. The Shawshank Redemption (1994) - This classic drama film tells the story of Andy Dufresne, a banker who is wrongfully convicted of murder. As he spends 20 years in prison, he learns to adapt to his circumstances and ultimately triumphs over his obstacles.

2. Forrest Gump (1994) - This heartwarming drama film tells the story of Forrest Gump, an uneducated man from Alabama who has a remarkable ability to survive even under extreme conditions. As he travels across America in the 1950s and 1960s, he encounters many famous people including Martin Luther King Jr., Robert Kennedy, and John F. Kennedy. Despite being innocent of most of the crimes that he is accused of, he manages to survive against all odds and ultimately achieve a level of success and happiness in life that few people are capable of achieving.
